chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dana T Slater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant is granted huber priveleges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.  this sentence would be consecutive to imposed sentence in 15CF96
Consecutive to: to stayed sentence in 15CF96

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report upon release to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation in 15CF38 and 15CF96 to run concurrent to each.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  

The defendant shall have no contact with  Katheryn Hulett of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to receive credit for 50 days served.
